titlestmt.titleproper: Preliminary Inventory to the Charles T. R. Bohannan Papers 1915-1985
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Processed by Charles T. R. Bohannan; machine-readable finding aid created by Xiuzhi Zhou, revised by Vishnu Jani

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-08-01T14:56-0700

change.item: August 1, 2014: Added motion picture information November 14, 2011: Added box 36 after rehousing box 34-35, added additional description June 30, 2011: Added declassified records series to container list March 15, 2011: Added unit id, updated code March 23, 2004:PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Charles T. R. Bohannan Papers)//EN" "bohannan.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.unittitle: Charles T. R. Bohannan papers

physdesc.extent: 32 manuscript boxes, 3 oversize boxes, 1 card file box, 1 motion picture film reel

did.abstract: Correspondence, reports, writings, memoranda, manuals, minutes of meetings, printed matter, microfilm, and photographs, relating to counter-guerrilla military operations, especially in the Philippines (1947-1965), Vietnam (1961-1970), elsewhere in southeast Asia, and Colombia (1959-1960); the Allied occupation government in Japan; and communism, especially in the United States.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Charles T. R. Bohannan papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Lieutenant colonel, United States Army; Rand Corporation consultant; counter-guerrilla expert.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Formerly security-classified records of the U.S. government. Includes some records determined by the government to be unclassified. Arranged chronologically by date of release by Hoover

did.unittitle: 2011 June release of records

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Articles and memo relating to the situation in Vietnam, 1962-1964, and letter from the American Embassy in Manila, Philippines, 1947. The articles are contained in the notebook with "Articles III HUAG" on the spine and "VN 11" noted on the cover, with titles indicated below

did.unittitle: 1. Working Draft: Political Evolution in South Vietnam, H. J. Gaffney, Jr., Policy Planning Staff/ISA
2. Notes on Current US Problem Areas in Vietnam, Chas. J. Zwick, Chas. Cooper, Hans Heyman, Richard Moorsteen
3. Memo: Current Breakdown of GVN Pol. Civic Action Programs for Forestal, signed by William E. Colby
4. Sixth Senior Seminar in Foreign Policy: The Evolution of Counter Insurgency Strategy, The case of Vietnam, pages, by Col. Richard M. Lee, USA
5. The United States and France in Vietnam: A Comparison Research Memo, RFE-34, from Thomas L. Hughes,
6. Chronology of United States-Vietnam Relations,
7. Obstacles to Mass Communication in Vietnam, USJS/WG Saigon,
"Vietnam" 16mm motion picture film, 150 feet
